intro: Heracleum nubigenum, commonly known as cloud-like cowparn. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its tall, hollow stems and large, umbrella-shaped compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Europe and western Asia, often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils. Heracleum nubigenum is known for its aromatic foliage and can be a common weed in agricultural areas.
